description: Change of use of two existing residential dwellings (1 x detached, 1 x semi-detached house Use Class C3) to provision of residential care home (Use Class C2)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with:

1901-010 (includes Site Location Plan), 1901-010, 1901-020, 1901-041, 1901-040, 02-20-16 - Existing plans (received: 22.05.2020), 02-20-17 H - Proposed plans and block plan (received 09.12.2021), Statement of purpose, Transport review technical review note
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of the residential care home hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The site shall be used as a residential care home for young people (up to 18 years old) only (Use Class C2) and shall not be used for any other purposes, including any other C2 use or any other uses in the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over the nature of the use, in the interests of restricting the uses of the building to those which are compatible with the site and area, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, all in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 3B and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4, T4, H12, of the London Plan (2021).of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The number of young people accommodated at the site shall not exceed a maximum of seven at any time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4, T4, H12, of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The number of staff at the site shall not exceed a maximum of three staff between the hours of 07:00 and 22:00 (day shift) and a maximum of one staff members between the hours of 22:00 and 07:00 (night shift).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4, T4, H12, of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan 2021.
| No part of the roof of the single storey projections shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of four (4) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site, within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
